docs.lead_paragraph: Federal prosecutors today accused two Long Island women and a prominent lawyer near the Arizona-Mexico border of running a baby-smuggling ring in which at least 17 Mexican infants were illegally sold to unwitting adoptive parents in the New York area for $20,000 or more. According to prosecutors, the Long Island women, Arlene Lieberman and Arlene Reingold, lured desperate would-be parents with promises of safe, easy, legal adoptions.

headline.main: U.S. Accuses 3 of Smuggling Mexican Babies

docs.abstract: Federal prosecutors accuse two Long Island women and a prominent lawyer near Arizona-Mexico border of running a baby-smuggling ring in which at least 17 Mexican infants were illegally sold to unwitting adoptive parents in New York area for $20,000 or more; prosecutors contend women, Arlene Lieberman and Arlene Reingold, lured desperate would-be parents with promises of safe, easy, legal adoptions; say, however, that adoptions turned out to be anything but legal; lawyer, Mario Reyes, forged birth certificates and consent forms, bribed Mexican officials to look the other way, and still ultimately failed to receive necessary approvals from United States immigration officials; the three are charged with conspiring to violate various immigration laws and to commit mail fraud and wire fraud; map (M)
docs.snippet: Federal prosecutors today accused two Long Island women and a prominent lawyer near the Arizona-Mexico border of running a baby-smuggling ring in which at least 17 Mexican infants were illegally sold to unwitting adoptive parents in the New York area...
docs.section_name: Front Page; New York and Region

docs.lead_paragraph: They Won't Grow Up It's easy to tell whether an audience has been won over by a production of ''Peter Pan.'' Just wait until the end of the second act (we're talking about the musical to which Moose Charlap, Carolyn Leigh, Betty Comden, Adolph Green and Jule Styne all contributed), when Tinker Bell drinks the poison intended for Peter. He asks for help: Tink can be saved only if children applaud to show that they believe in fairies.
docs.abstract: Family Fare list of activities of interest to families in New York this weekend; Broadway musical Peter Pan, children's alternate rock festival and Lower East Side Festival of the Arts noted; photo (S)

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: LOWER EAST SIDE FESTIVAL OF THE ARTS

docs.lead_paragraph: After six months of deliberation, a Presidential commission is close to recommending that scientists supported by Federal grants should be allowed to conduct a specific kind of research on abandoned human embryos and that Congress should not block such research, as it has done for the past three years. The research would be limited to the derivation of embryonic stem cells, the primordial cells from which all the tissues and organs of the body develop. The embryos from which the cells are derived, which at this stage are just a tiny blob of cells, are created in a fertility clinic procedure that often produces more than are required for a pregnancy.

headline.main: Recommendation Is Near On Embryo Cell Research

docs.abstract: National Bioethics Advisory Commission, Presidential panel, is close to recommending that scientists supported by Federal grants should be allowed to conduct specific kind of research on abandoned human embryos and that Congress should not block such research, as it has done for past three years; research would be limited to derivation of embryonic stem cells; embryos from which cells are derived are created in fertility clinic procedure that often produces more than are required for pregnancy; opponents of abortion object to Federal financing of any research that requires destruction of human embryo (M)
docs.snippet: After six months of deliberation, a Presidential commission is close to recommending that scientists supported by Federal grants should be allowed to conduct a specific kind of research on abandoned human embryos and that Congress should not block...
